1241     * is the RGBA color 0.5, 0.5, 1.0, 1.0 . A typical usage to achieve a fog effect would be to raise lightness (r),
1242     * slightly reduce saturation (g), sharply flatten the original texture's lightness (b), and leave alpha alone (a):
1243     * 0.7, 0.4, 0.2, 1.0 .
1244     * <br>
1245     * This doesn't use a standard type of color; you should use something like
1246     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)} to set the channels in
1247     * the specific way this uses them.
1248     * <br>
1249     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1250     * @see #fragmentShaderFlatLightness if you only need one contrast setting and still want to set color tints
1251     */
1252    public static String fragmentShaderConfigurableContrast =
1253            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1254                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1255                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1256                    "#else\n" +
1257                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1258                    "#endif\n" +
1259                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1260                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1261                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1262                    "void main()\n" +
1263                    "{\n" +
1264                    "    vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1265                    "    vec3 ipt = (mat3(0.189786, 0.669665 , 0.286498, 0.576951, -0.73741 , 0.655205, 0.233221, 0.0681367, -0.941748)\n" +
1266                    "         * tgt.rgb);\n" +
1267                    "    ipt.x = (ipt.x - 0.5) * v_color.b + v_color.r;\n" + // preserves some lightness based on b, sets main lightness with r
1268                    "    ipt.yz *= v_color.g * 2.0;\n" + // the green channel affects saturation; if it's 0.5 it won't change saturation.
1269                    "    vec3 back = clamp(mat3(0.999779, 1.00015, 0.999769, 1.07094, -0.377744, 0.0629496, 0.324891, 0.220439, -0.809638) * ipt, 0.0, 1.0);\n" +
1270                    "    gl_FragColor = vec4(back, v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1271                    "}";
1272
1273    /**
1274     * A day/night cycle shader that can be used without any other parts of this library. This only needs setting the
1275     * uniform {@code u_timeOfDay} to any float; the rate at which you change this float affects how fast the day/night
1276     * cycle occurs. This is meant to be used with {@link #fragmentShaderDayNight}. Together, they make the color
1277     * adjustment go from bluish and dark at night, to purplish at dawn, to orange/yellow and bright at mid-day, toward
1278     * red at dusk, and then back to bluish at night. This uses an RGBA batch color.
1279     * <br>
1280     * Editing this shader is strongly encouraged to fit your needs! The time-based variables st, ct, and dd can all be
1281     * adjusted to increase or decrease the strength of the effect, and their effects can also be adjusted upon v_color
1282     * and v_tweak.
1283     * <br>
1284     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1285     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1286     */
1287    public static String vertexShaderDayNight = "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
1288            + "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
1289            + "attribute vec2 " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
1290            + "uniform mat4 u_projTrans;\n"
1291            + "uniform float u_timeOfDay;\n"
1292            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
1293            + "varying vec4 v_tweak;\n"
1294            + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
1295            + "varying float v_lightFix;\n"
1296            + "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n"
1297            + "\n"
1298            + "void main()\n"
1299            + "{\n"
1300            + "   float st = sin(1.5707963 * sin(0.2617994 * u_timeOfDay)); // Whenever st is very high or low... \n"
1301            + "   float ct = sin(1.5707963 * cos(0.2617994 * u_timeOfDay)); // ...ct is close to 0, and vice versa. \n"
1302            + "   float dd = ct * ct; // Positive, small; used for dawn and dusk. \n"
1303            + "   v_color = " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
1304            + "   v_color.w = v_color.w * (255.0/254.0);\n"
1305            + "   vec3 oklab = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *"
1306            + "     pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n"
1307            + "     * (v_color.rgb * v_color.rgb), forward);\n"
1308            + "   // The next four lines make use of the time-based variables st, ct, and dd. Edit to fit. \n"
1309            + "   v_color.x = clamp(oklab.x + (0.0625 * st), 0.0, 1.0);\n"
1310            + "   v_color.yz = clamp(oklab.yz + vec2(0.0625 * dd + 0.03125 * st, 0.1 * st), -1.0, 1.0) * ((dd + 0.25) * 0.5);\n"
1311            + "   v_tweak = vec4(0.2 * st + 0.5);\n"
1312            + "   v_tweak.w = pow((1.0 - 0.125 * st), 1.709);\n"
1313            + "   v_lightFix = 1.0 + pow(v_tweak.w, 1.41421356);\n"
1314            + "   v_texCoords = " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
1315            + "   gl_Position =  u_projTrans * " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
1316            + "}\n";
1317    /**
1318     * The fragment shader counterpart to {@link #vertexShaderDayNight}; must be used with that vertex shader. See its
1319     * docs for more info, particularly about the one uniform this needs set. This uses an RGBA batch color.
1320     * <br>
1321     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1322     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1323     * <br>
1324     * Meant only for use with {@link #vertexShaderDayNight}.
1325     */
1326    public static String fragmentShaderDayNight =
1327            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1328                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1329                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1330                    "#else\n" +
1331                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1332                    "#endif\n" +
1333                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1334                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1335                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_tweak;\n" +
1336                    "varying float v_lightFix;\n" +
1337                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1338                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1339                    "void main()\n" +
1340                    "{\n" +
1341                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1342                    "  vec3 lab = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1343                    "             pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1344                    "             * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n" +
1345                    "  lab.x = clamp(pow(lab.x, v_tweak.w) * v_lightFix * v_tweak.x + v_color.x - 1.0, 0.0, 1.0);\n" +
1346                    "  lab.yz = clamp((lab.yz * v_tweak.yz + v_color.yz) * 1.5, -1.0, 1.0);\n" +
1347                    "  lab = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, +0.3963377774, -0.1055613458, -0.0894841775, +0.2158037573, -0.0638541728, -1.2914855480) * lab;\n" +
1348                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp(" +
1349                    "                 mat3(+4.0767245293, -1.2681437731, -0.0041119885, -3.3072168827, +2.6093323231, -0.7034763098, +0.2307590544, -0.3411344290, +1.7068625689) *\n" +
1350                    "                 (lab * lab * lab)," +
1351                    "                 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1352                    "}";
1353
1354    /**
1355     * Takes a batch color in CIE LAB format (but ranging from 0 to 1 instead of its normal larger range).
1356     * Adapted from <a href="https://www.shadertoy.com/view/lsdGzN">This ShaderToy by nmz</a>.
1357     * <br>
1358     * You can generate CIELAB colors using any of various methods in the {@code cielab} package, such as
1359     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.cielab.ColorTools#cielab(float, float, float, float)}.
1360     * <br>
1361     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1362     */
1363    public static String fragmentShaderCielab =
1364            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1365            "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1366            "precision mediump float;\n" +
1367            "#else\n" +
1368            "#define LOWP \n" +
1369            "#endif\n" +
1370            "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1371            "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1372            "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1373            "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1374            "const vec3 sRGBFrom = vec3(2.4);\n" +
1375            "const vec3 sRGBThresholdFrom = vec3(0.04045);\n" +
1376            "const vec3 sRGBTo = vec3(1.0 / 2.4);\n" +
1377            "const vec3 sRGBThresholdTo = vec3(0.0031308);\n" +
1378            "const vec3 epsilon = vec3(0.00885645);\n" +
1379            "vec3 linear(vec3 t){ return mix(pow((t + 0.055) * (1.0 / 1.055), sRGBFrom), t * (1.0/12.92), step(t, sRGBThresholdFrom)); }\n" +
1380            "vec3 sRGB(vec3 t){ return mix(1.055 * pow(t, sRGBTo) - 0.055, 12.92*t, step(t, sRGBThresholdTo)); }\n" +
1381            "float xyzF(float t){ return mix(pow(t,1./3.), 7.787037 * t + 0.139731, step(t, 0.00885645)); }\n" +
1382            "vec3 xyzF(vec3 t){ return mix(pow(t, forward), 7.787037 * t + 0.139731, step(t, epsilon)); }\n" +
1383            "float xyzR(float t){ return mix(t*t*t , 0.1284185 * (t - 0.139731), step(t, 0.20689655)); }\n" +
1384            "vec3 rgb2lab(vec3 c)\n" +
1385            "{\n" +
1386            "    c *= mat3(0.4124, 0.3576, 0.1805,\n" +
1387            "              0.2126, 0.7152, 0.0722,\n" +
1388            "              0.0193, 0.1192, 0.9505);\n" +
1389            "    c = xyzF(c);\n" +
1390            "    vec3 lab = vec3(max(0.,1.16*c.y - 0.16), (c.x - c.y) * 5.0, (c.y - c.z) * 2.0); \n" +
1391            "    return lab;\n" +
1392//            "    return vec3(lab.x, length(vec2(lab.y,lab.z)), atan(lab.z, lab.y));\n" +
1393            "}\n" +
1394            "vec3 lab2rgb(vec3 c)\n" +
1395            "{\n" +
1396//            "    c = vec3(c.x, cos(c.z) * c.y, sin(c.z) * c.y);\n" +
1397            "    float lg = 1./1.16*(c.x + 0.16);\n" +
1398            "    vec3 xyz = vec3(xyzR(lg + c.y * 0.2),\n" +
1399            "                    xyzR(lg),\n" +
1400            "                    xyzR(lg - c.z * 0.5));\n" +
1401            "    vec3 rgb = xyz*mat3( 3.2406, -1.5372,-0.4986,\n" +
1402            "                        -0.9689,  1.8758, 0.0415,\n" +
1403            "                         0.0557, -0.2040, 1.0570);\n" +
1404            "    return rgb;\n" +
1405            "}\n" +
1406            "void main()\n" +
1407            "{\n" +
1408            "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1409            "  vec3 lab = rgb2lab(linear(tgt.rgb));\n" +
1410            "  lab.x = lab.x + v_color.r - 0.5372549;\n" +
1411            "  lab.yz = lab.yz + (v_color.gb - 0.5) * 2.0;\n" +
1412            "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sRGB(clamp(lab2rgb(lab), 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1413            "}";
1414
1415    /**
1416     * Makes the colors in the given textures almost-grayscale, then moves their chromatic channels much closer to the
1417     * batch color, without changing the lightness. The result is almost all the same hue as the batch color, and can be
1418     * gray if the batch color is any grayscale color. This uses an RGB batch color for simpler usage in most code that
1419     * doesn't already use colorful-gdx. There can be some contribution from the original texture, so even if the batch
1420     * color is gray, then the result will probably have some very muted colors.
1421     * <br>
1422     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1423     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1424     * <br>
1425     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1426     */
1427    public static String fragmentShaderColorize =
1428            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1429                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1430                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1431                    "#else\n" +
1432                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1433                    "#endif\n" +
1434                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1435                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1436                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1437                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1438                    "void main()\n" +
1439                    "{\n" +
1440                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1441                    "//// Ugly repeated matrix math to convert from RGB to Oklab. Oklab keeps lightness separate from hue and saturation.\n" +
1442                    "  vec3 base = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1443                    "              pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1444                    "              * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n" +
1445                    "  vec3 tint = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1446                    "              pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1447                    "              * (v_color.rgb * v_color.rgb), forward);\n" +
1448                    "//// Sharply increases lightness contrast, to counteract the gray-ing caused by averaging base and tint lightness.\n" +
1449                    "  tint.x = (tint.x + base.x) - 1.0;\n" +
1450                    "  tint.x = sign(tint.x) * pow(abs(tint.x), 0.7) * 0.5 + 0.5;\n" +
1451                    "//// Uncomment these next 3 lines if you want the original image to contribute some color, if it has any.\n" +
1452                    "  float blen = length(base.yz);\n" +
1453                    "  blen *= blen;\n" +
1454                    "  tint.yz = clamp(tint.yz * (0.7 + blen) + base.yz * (0.3 - blen), -1.0, 1.0);\n" +
1455                    "//// Reverse the Oklab conversion to get back to RGB. Uses the batch color's alpha normally.\n" +
1456                    "  tint = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, +0.3963377774, -0.1055613458, -0.0894841775, +0.2158037573, -0.0638541728, -1.2914855480) * tint;\n" +
1457                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp(" +
1458                    "                 mat3(+4.0767245293, -1.2681437731, -0.0041119885, -3.3072168827, +2.6093323231, -0.7034763098, +0.2307590544, -0.3411344290, +1.7068625689) *\n" +
1459                    "                 (tint * tint * tint)," +
1460                    "                 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1461                    "}";
1462
1463    /**
1464     * Makes the colors in the given textures almost-grayscale, then moves their chromatic channels much closer to the
1465     * batch color's chromatic channels, without changing the lightness. The result is almost all the same hue as the
1466     * batch color, and can be gray if the batch color is any grayscale color. The lightness of the batch color is used
1467     * to determine how strong the effect should be; you may want to use an out-of-gamut color for very strong tint
1468     * effects, because those need to be light and the lightest gamut is just one point. This uses an Oklab batch color.
1469     * There is some contribution from the original texture, varied based on the batch lightness, so even if the batch
1470     * color is gray, then the result will probably have some very muted colors.
1471     * <br>
1472     * You can generate Oklab colors using any of various methods in the {@code oklab} package, such as
1473     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.oklab.ColorTools#oklab(float, float, float, float)}.
1474     * <br>
1475     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1476     */
1477    public static String fragmentShaderColorizeOklab =
1478            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1479                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1480                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1481                    "#else\n" +
1482                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1483                    "#endif\n" +
1484                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1485                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1486                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1487                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1488                    "void main()\n" +
1489                    "{\n" +
1490                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1491                    "  vec3 base = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1492                    "              pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1493                    "              * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n" +
1494                    "  vec2 tint = v_color.gb - 0.5;\n" +
1495                    "  base.x = clamp(base.x, 0.0, 1.0);\n" +
1496                    "  float blen = length(base.yz);\n" +
1497                    "  blen *= blen;\n" +
1498                    "  base.gb = clamp(tint * (v_color.r + blen) + base.yz * (1.0 - v_color.r - blen), -1.0, 1.0);\n" +
1499                    "  base = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, +0.3963377774, -0.1055613458, -0.0894841775, +0.2158037573, -0.0638541728, -1.2914855480) * base;\n" +
1500                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp(" +
1501                    "                 mat3(+4.0767245293, -1.2681437731, -0.0041119885, -3.3072168827, +2.6093323231, -0.7034763098, +0.2307590544, -0.3411344290, +1.7068625689) *\n" +
1502                    "                 (base * base * base)," +
1503                    "                 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1504                    "}";
1505    /**
1506     * The simplest possible color-inverting shader for a SpriteBatch, this just takes each RGB channel and subtracts it
1507     * from 1.0 to get the value this uses. This uses an RGBA batch color.
1508     * <br>
1509     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1510     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1511     * <br>
1512     * Meant only for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1513     */
1514    public static final String fragmentShaderInvertedRGB =
1515            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1516                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1517                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1518                    "#else\n" +
1519                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1520                    "#endif\n" +
1521                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1522                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1523                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1524                    "void main()\n" +
1525                    "{\n" +
1526                    "   vec4 tgt = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords);\n" +
1527                    "   gl_FragColor = vec4(1.0 - tgt.rgb * v_color.rgb, v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1528                    "}";
1529
1530    /**
1531     * Just like {@link #fragmentShaderInvertedRGB}, but internally converts to Oklab, so it can invert just lightness
1532     * without changing color hue or saturation. This uses an RGBA batch color.
1533     * <br>
1534     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1535     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1536     * <br>
1537     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1538     */
1539    public static String fragmentShaderInvertedLightness =
1540            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1541                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1542                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1543                    "#else\n" +
1544                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1545                    "#endif\n" +
1546                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1547                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1548                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1549                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1550                    "float toOklab(float L) {\n" +
1551                    "        const float shape = 0.64516133, turning = 0.95;\n" +
1552                    "        float d = turning - L;\n" +
1553                    "        float r = mix(\n" +
1554                    "          ((1. - turning) * (L - 1.)) / (1. - (L + shape * d)) + 1.,\n" +
1555                    "          (turning * L) / (1.0e-20 + (L + shape * d)),\n" +
1556                    "          step(0.0, d));\n" +
1557                    "        return r * r;\n" +
1558                    "}\n" +
1559                    "float fromOklab(float L) {\n" +
1560                    "        const float shape = 1.55, turning = 0.95;\n" +
1561                    "        L = sqrt(L);\n" +
1562                    "        float d = turning - L;\n" +
1563                    "        return mix(\n" +
1564                    "          ((1. - turning) * (L - 1.)) / (1. - (L + shape * d)) + 1.,\n" +
1565                    "          (turning * L) / (1.0e-20 + (L + shape * d)),\n" +
1566                    "          step(0.0, d));\n" +
1567                    "}\n" +
1568//                    "float toOklab(float L) {\n" +
1569//                    "  return (L - 1.0) / (1.0 - L * 0.4285714) + 1.0;\n" +
1570//                    "}\n" +
1571//                    "float fromOklab(float L) {\n" +
1572//                    "  return (L - 1.0) / (1.0 + L * 0.75) + 1.0;\n" +
1573//                    "}\n" +
1574                    "void main()\n" +
1575                    "{\n" +
1576                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords ) * v_color;\n" +
1577                    "  vec3 lab = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1578                    "             pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1579                    "             * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n" +
1580                    "  lab.x = fromOklab(1.0 - toOklab(lab.x));\n" +
1581                    "  lab = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, +0.3963377774, -0.1055613458, -0.0894841775, +0.2158037573, -0.0638541728, -1.2914855480) * lab;\n" +
1582                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp(" +
1583                    "                 mat3(+4.0767245293, -1.2681437731, -0.0041119885, -3.3072168827, +2.6093323231, -0.7034763098, +0.2307590544, -0.3411344290, +1.7068625689) *\n" +
1584                    "                 (lab * lab * lab)," +
1585                    "                 0.0, 1.0)), tgt.a);\n" +
1586                    "}";
1587
1588    /**
1589     * Just like {@link #fragmentShaderInvertedLightness}, but instead of inverting lightness, this tries to change only
1590     * hue, without changing lightness or (generally) saturation. This works internally by negating the A and B
1591     * components of the color (as Oklab). This uses an RGBA batch color.
1592     * <br>
1593     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1594     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1595     * <br>
1596     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1597     */
1598    public static String fragmentShaderInvertedChroma =
1599            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1600                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1601                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1602                    "#else\n" +
1603                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1604                    "#endif\n" +
1605                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1606                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1607                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1608                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1609                    "void main()\n" +
1610                    "{\n" +
1611                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords ) * v_color;\n" +
1612                    "  vec3 lab = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1613                    "             pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1614                    "             * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n" +
1615                    "  lab.yz = -lab.yz;\n" +
1616                    "  lab = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, +0.3963377774, -0.1055613458, -0.0894841775, +0.2158037573, -0.0638541728, -1.2914855480) * lab;\n" +
1617                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp(" +
1618                    "                 mat3(+4.0767245293, -1.2681437731, -0.0041119885, -3.3072168827, +2.6093323231, -0.7034763098, +0.2307590544, -0.3411344290, +1.7068625689) *\n" +
1619                    "                 (lab * lab * lab)," +
1620                    "                 0.0, 1.0)), tgt.a);\n" +
1621                    "}";
1622
1623    /**
1624     * Just like {@link #fragmentShaderInvertedChroma}, but instead of inverting chroma, this tries to significantly
1625     * increase the saturation of a color (by pushing chroma away from gray). This works internally by multiplying the A
1626     * and B components of the color (as Oklab) by 2.0 . This uses an RGBA batch color.
1627     * <br>
1628     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1629     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1630     * <br>
1631     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1632     */
1633    public static String fragmentShaderDoubleSaturation =
1634            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1635                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1636                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1637                    "#else\n" +
1638                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1639                    "#endif\n" +
1640                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1641                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1642                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1643                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1644                    "void main()\n" +
1645                    "{\n" +
1646                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords ) * v_color;\n" +
1647                    "  vec3 lab = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1648                    "             pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1649                    "             * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n" +
1650                    "  lab.yz *=   2.000  ;\n" +
1651                    "  lab = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, +0.3963377774, -0.1055613458, -0.0894841775, +0.2158037573, -0.0638541728, -1.2914855480) * lab;\n" +
1652                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp(" +
1653                    "                 mat3(+4.0767245293, -1.2681437731, -0.0041119885, -3.3072168827, +2.6093323231, -0.7034763098, +0.2307590544, -0.3411344290, +1.7068625689) *\n" +
1654                    "                 (lab * lab * lab)," +
1655                    "                 0.0, 1.0)), tgt.a);\n" +
1656                    "}";
1657
1658    /**
1659     * Prepares and returns a new SpriteBatch that uses {@link #vertexShader} and {@link #fragmentShaderDoubleSaturation}
1660     * from this class, making it able to render RGBA colors from the libGDX or the rgb package. This also takes a
1661     * {@code saturationMultiplier} parameter, which modifies the saturation in the fragment shader so it doesn't have
1662     * to always double the saturation, and can change it by more or less. If greater than 1.0, saturationMultiplier
1663     * will make colors more saturated/rich/vivid, while if it is less than 1.0 it will make all colors closer to gray.
1664     * Using 0.0 will make all colors grayscale.
1665     * <br>
1666     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1667     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1668     *
1669     * @param saturationMultiplier what to multiply the saturation by; 1.0 will have no change, 0.5 desaturates, 2.0 over-saturates
1670     * @return a freshly allocated SpriteBatch that will also have a new ShaderProgram for rendering RGB with contrast
1671     */
1672    public static SpriteBatch makeSaturatingBatch(final float saturationMultiplier)
1673    {
1674        ShaderProgram shader = new ShaderProgram(vertexShader, fragmentShaderDoubleSaturation.replace("   2.0   ", Float.toString(saturationMultiplier)));
1675        if(!shader.isCompiled())
1676            throw new GdxRuntimeException("Couldn't compile shader: " + shader.getLog());
1677        return new SpriteBatch(1000, shader);
1678    }
1679
1680    /**
1681     * This is similar to the default vertex shader from libGDX, but also does some expensive setup work for HSLuv batch
1682     * colors per-vertex instead of per-fragment. It is needed if you use {@link #fragmentShaderHsluv}.
1683     */
1684    public static final String vertexShaderHsluv =
1685            "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
1686            + "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
1687            + "attribute vec2 " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
1688            + "uniform mat4 u_projTrans;\n"
1689            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
1690            + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
1691            +
1692            "const vec3 epsilon = vec3(0.0088564516790356308);\n" +
1693            "const float kappa = 9.032962962;\n" +
1694            "const mat3 m =" +
1695            "         mat3(+3.240969941904521, -1.537383177570093, -0.498610760293000,\n" +
1696            "              -0.969243636280870, +1.875967501507720, +0.041555057407175,\n" +
1697            "              +0.055630079696993, -0.203976958888970, +1.056971514242878);\n" +
1698            "float intersectLength (float sn, float cs, float line1, float line2) {\n" +
1699            "    return line2 / (sn - line1 * cs);\n" +
1700            "}\n" +
1701            "float chromaLimit(float hue, float lightness) {\n" +
1702            "        float sn = sin(hue);\n" +
1703            "        float cs = cos(hue);\n" +
1704            "        float sub1 = (lightness + 0.16) / 1.16;\n" +
1705            "        sub1 *= sub1 * sub1;\n" +
1706            "        float sub2 = sub1 > epsilon.x ? sub1 : lightness / kappa;\n" +
1707            "        float mn = 1.0e20;\n" +
1708            "        vec3 ms = m[0] * sub2;\n" +
1709            "        float msy, top1, top2, bottom, length;\n" +
1710            "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
1711            "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1712            "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1713            "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1714            "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1715            "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1716            "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
1717            "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1718            "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1719            "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1720            "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1721            "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1722            "        ms = m[1] * sub2;\n" +
1723            "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
1724            "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1725            "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1726            "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1727            "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1728            "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1729            "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
1730            "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1731            "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1732            "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1733            "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1734            "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1735            "        ms = m[2] * sub2;\n" +
1736            "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
1737            "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1738            "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1739            "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1740            "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1741            "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1742            "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
1743            "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1744            "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1745            "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1746            "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1747            "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1748            "        return mn;\n" +
1749            "}\n" +
1750            "vec3 hsl2luv(vec3 c)\n" +
1751            "{\n" +
1752            "    float L = c.z;\n" +
1753            "    float C = chromaLimit(c.x, L) * c.y;\n" +
1754            "    float U = cos(c.x) * C;\n" +
1755            "    float V = sin(c.x) * C;\n" +
1756            "    return vec3(L, U, V);\n" +
1757            "}\n"
1758            + "void main()\n"
1759            + "{\n"
1760            + "   v_color = " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
1761            + "   v_color.w = v_color.w * (255.0/254.0);\n"
1762            + "   v_color.x *= 6.2831;\n"
1763            + "   v_color.rgb = hsl2luv(v_color.rgb);\n"
1764            + "   v_texCoords = " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
1765            + "   gl_Position =  u_projTrans * " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
1766            + "}\n";
1767
1768    /**
1769     * Just like {@link #fragmentShaderOklab}, but uses the HSLuv color space instead of the Oklab one.
1770     * This also gamma-corrects the inputs and outputs, though it uses subtly different math internally.
1771     * <br>
1772     * You can generate HSLuv colors using any of various methods in the {@code hsluv} package, such as
1773     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.hsluv.ColorTools#hsluv(float, float, float, float)}.
1774     * <br>
1775     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShaderHsluv}.
1776     */
1777    public static String fragmentShaderHsluv =
1778            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1779                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1780                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1781                    "#else\n" +
1782                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1783                    "#endif\n" +
1784                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1785                    "varying vec4 v_color;\n" +
1786                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1787                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1788                    "const vec3 sRGBFrom = vec3(2.4);\n" +
1789                    "const vec3 sRGBThresholdFrom = vec3(0.04045);\n" +
1790                    "const vec3 sRGBTo = vec3(1.0 / 2.4);\n" +
1791                    "const vec3 sRGBThresholdTo = vec3(0.0031308);\n" +
1792                    "const vec3 epsilon = vec3(0.0088564516790356308);\n" +
1793                    "const float kappa = 9.032962962;\n" +
1794                    "const vec2 refUV = vec2(0.19783000664283681, 0.468319994938791);\n" +
1795                    "const mat3 m =" +
1796                    "         mat3(+3.240969941904521, -1.537383177570093, -0.498610760293000,\n" +
1797                    "              -0.969243636280870, +1.875967501507720, +0.041555057407175,\n" +
1798                    "              +0.055630079696993, -0.203976958888970, +1.056971514242878);\n" +
1799                    "const mat3 mInv =\n" +
1800                    "         mat3(0.41239079926595948 , 0.35758433938387796, 0.180480788401834290,\n" +
1801                    "              0.21263900587151036 , 0.71516867876775593, 0.072192315360733715,\n" +
1802                    "              0.019330818715591851, 0.11919477979462599, 0.950532152249660580);\n" +
1803                    "vec3 linear(vec3 t){ return mix(pow((t + 0.055) * (1.0 / 1.055), sRGBFrom), t * (1.0/12.92), step(t, sRGBThresholdFrom)); }\n" +
1804                    "vec3 sRGB(vec3 t){ return mix(1.055 * pow(t, sRGBTo) - 0.055, 12.92*t, step(t, sRGBThresholdTo)); }\n" +
1805                    "float xyzF(float t){ return mix(pow(t,1./3.), 7.787037 * t + 0.139731, step(t, epsilon.x)); }\n" +
1806                    "vec3 xyzF(vec3 t){ return mix(pow(t, forward), 7.787037 * t + 0.139731, step(t, epsilon)); }\n" +
1807                    "float xyzR(float t){ return mix(t*t*t , 0.1284185 * (t - 0.139731), step(t, 0.20689655)); }\n" +
1808                    "float intersectLength (float sn, float cs, float line1, float line2) {\n" +
1809                    "    return line2 / (sn - line1 * cs);\n" +
1810                    "}\n" +
1811                    "float chromaLimit(float hue, float lightness) {\n" +
1812                    "        float sn = sin(hue);\n" +
1813                    "        float cs = cos(hue);\n" +
1814                    "        float sub1 = (lightness + 0.16) / 1.16;\n" +
1815                    "        sub1 *= sub1 * sub1;\n" +
1816                    "        float sub2 = sub1 > epsilon.x ? sub1 : lightness / kappa;\n" +
1817                    "        float mn = 1.0e20;\n" +
1818                    "        vec3 ms = m[0] * sub2;\n" +
1819                    "        float msy, top1, top2, bottom, length;\n" +
1820                    "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
1821                    "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1822                    "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1823                    "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1824                    "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1825                    "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1826                    "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
1827                    "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1828                    "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1829                    "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1830                    "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1831                    "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1832                    "        ms = m[1] * sub2;\n" +
1833                    "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
1834                    "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1835                    "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1836                    "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1837                    "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1838                    "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1839                    "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
1840                    "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1841                    "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1842                    "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1843                    "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1844                    "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1845                    "        ms = m[2] * sub2;\n" +
1846                    "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
1847                    "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1848                    "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1849                    "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1850                    "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1851                    "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1852                    "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
1853                    "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1854                    "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1855                    "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1856                    "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1857                    "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1858                    "        return mn;\n" +
1859                    "}\n" +
1860                    "vec3 rgb2luv(vec3 c)\n" +
1861                    "{\n" +
1862                    "    c *= mInv;" +
1863                    "    float L = max(0.,1.16*pow(c.y, 1.0 / 3.0) - 0.16);\n" +
1864                    "    vec2 uv;\n" +
1865                    "    if(L < 0.0001) uv = vec2(0.0);\n" +
1866                    "    else uv = 13. * L * (vec2(4., 9.) * c.xy / (c.x + 15. * c.y + 3. * c.z) - refUV);\n" +
1867                    "    return vec3(L, uv);\n" +
1868                    "}\n" +
1869                    "float forwardLight(float L) {\n" +
1870                    "        const float shape = 0.8528, turning = 0.1;\n" +
1871                    "        float d = turning - L;\n" +
1872                    "        return mix(\n" +
1873                    "          ((1. - turning) * (L - 1.)) / (1. - (L + shape * d)) + 1.,\n" +
1874                    "          (turning * L) / (1.0e-20 + (L + shape * d)),\n" +
1875                    "          step(0.0, d));\n" +
1876                    "}\n" +
1877                    "float reverseLight(float L) {\n" +
1878                    "        const float shape = 1.1726, turning = 0.1;\n" +
1879                    "        float d = turning - L;\n" +
1880                    "        return mix(\n" +
1881                    "          ((1. - turning) * (L - 1.)) / (1. - (L + shape * d)) + 1.,\n" +
1882                    "          (turning * L) / (1.0e-20 + (L + shape * d)),\n" +
1883                    "          step(0.0, d));\n" +
1884                    "}\n" +
1885                    "vec3 luv2rgb(vec3 c)\n" +
1886                    "{\n" +
1887                    "    float L = reverseLight(c.x);\n" +
1888                    "    float U = c.y;\n" +
1889                    "    float V = c.z;\n" +
1890                    "    float lim = chromaLimit(atan(V, U), L);\n" +
1891                    "    float len = length(vec2(U,V));\n" +
1892                    "    if(len > lim) {\n" +
1893                    "      lim /= len;\n" +
1894                    "      U *= lim;\n" +
1895                    "      V *= lim;\n" +
1896                    "    }\n" +
1897                    "    if (L <= 0.0001) {\n" +
1898                    "        return vec3(0.0);\n" +
1899                    "    } else if(L >= 0.9999) {\n" +
1900                    "        return vec3(1.0);\n" +
1901                    "    } else {\n" +
1902                    "      if (L <= 0.08) {\n" +
1903                    "        c.y = L / kappa;\n" +
1904                    "      } else {\n" +
1905                    "        c.y = (L + 0.16) / 1.16;\n" +
1906                    "        c.y *= c.y * c.y;\n" +
1907                    "      }\n" +
1908                    "    }\n" +
1909                    "    float iL = 1. / (13.0 * L);\n" +
1910                    "    float varU = U * iL + refUV.x;\n" +
1911                    "    float varV = V * iL + refUV.y;\n" +
1912                    "    c.x = 2.25 * varU * c.y / varV;\n" +
1913                    "    c.z = (3. / varV - 5.) * c.y - (c.x / 3.);\n" +
1914                    "    vec3 rgb = c * m;\n" +
1915                    "    return rgb;\n" +
1916                    "}\n" +
1917                    "void main()\n" +
1918                    "{\n" +
1919                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1920                    "  vec3 luv = rgb2luv(linear(tgt.rgb));\n" +
1921                    "  luv.x = forwardLight(clamp(luv.x + v_color.x - 0.5372549, 0.0, 1.0));\n" +
1922                    "  luv.yz = (luv.yz) + (v_color.yz);\n" +
1923                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sRGB(clamp(luv2rgb(luv), 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1924                    "}";
1925
1926    /**
1927     * A simple shader that renders just like SpriteBatch's default shader, except that when it would draw white, it
1928     * instead draws red (which can be replaced in the shader code with a custom color, as with
1929     * {@link #makeSwappingBatch(float, float, float)}).
1930     * <br>
1931     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1932     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}, or just by using normal
1933     * SpriteBatch and Color methods.
1934     * <br>
1935     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1936     */
1937    public static final String fragmentShaderSwapWhite =
1938            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1939                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1940                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1941                    "#else\n" +
1942                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1943                    "#endif\n" +
1944                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1945                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1946                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1947                    "void main()\n" +
1948                    "{\n" +
1949                    "   vec4 tgt = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords);\n" +
1950                    "   if(tgt.r + tgt.g + tgt.b == 3.0)\n" + // color of the pixel in the Texture must be white
1951                    "     gl_FragColor = vec4(   1.00, 0.00, 0.00   , tgt.a) * v_color;\n" +
1952                    "   else\n" +
1953                    "     gl_FragColor = tgt * v_color;\n" +
1954                    "}";
1955
1956    /**
1957     * Prepares and returns a new SpriteBatch that uses {@link #vertexShader} and {@link #fragmentShaderSwapWhite}
1958     * from this class, making it able to render RGBA colors from libGDX or the rgb package. This also takes red, green,
1959     * and blue parameters, each between 0.0 and 1.0, which define the color that white will be replaced with.
1960     * <br>
1961     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1962     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}, or just by using normal
1963     * SpriteBatch and Color methods.
1964     *
1965     * @param red   between 0.0 and 1.0, the red value of the color to replace white with.
1966     * @param green between 0.0 and 1.0, the green value of the color to replace white with.
1967     * @param blue  between 0.0 and 1.0, the blue value of the color to replace white with.
1968     * @return a freshly allocated SpriteBatch that will also have a new ShaderProgram for rendering RGB with contrast
1969     */
1970    public static SpriteBatch makeSwappingBatch(final float red, final float green, final float blue)
1971    {
1972        ShaderProgram shader = new ShaderProgram(vertexShader, fragmentShaderSwapWhite.replace("   1.00, 0.00, 0.00   ", red + ", " + green + ", " + blue));
1973        if(!shader.isCompiled())
1974            throw new GdxRuntimeException("Couldn't compile shader: " + shader.getLog());
1975        return new SpriteBatch(1000, shader);
1976    }
1977
1978}
